alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Dorchester; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton, Dorchester and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from near Varnville through Bells Crossroads to Canadys. As much as 1 to 2.5 inches has already fallen in some areas this evening. An additional 1 to 3 inches could fall through 915 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Hampton, Lake Warren State Park, Colleton, Varnville, Brunson, Smoaks, Williams, Islandton, Ruffin, Ashton, Miley, Cummings, Crocketville, Early Branch, Almeda Intersection, Canadys, Bells Crossroads, Caldwell and Smyly.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
